alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 7:34PM MST until August 25 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Calva...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural fields flooded in bylas and geronimo areas. Portions of highway 70 near bylas threatened. Highway 70 bridge approaches near bylas threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MST Monday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.9 feet late Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 745 AM MST.
